channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Companies Stop Hiring Nationally, Small Businesses Struggle to Fill Job Openings
item.description: The new NFIB monthly survey finds a third of business owners were unable to fill jobs in October, and are cutting back their recruiting plans.

item.title: The ‘low-hire, low-fire’ job market is leaving unemployed Americans in limbo
item.description: When Carly Kaprive left a job in Kansas City and moved to Chicago a year ago, she figured it would take three to six months to find a new position . A...

item.title: Sotheby’s bid to turn an architectural destination into destiny
item.description: Despite its status as an architectural celebrity, the Breuer building, commissioned by the Whitney Museum in the 1960s, has never had an easy relation...

item.title: ‘You can’t expect people to go in to work when they’re not getting a paycheck’: Travelers sympathize despite 800 downed Friday flights
item.description: The 40 airports selected for the slowdown span over two dozen states and include hubs such as Atlanta, Dallas, Denver, LA and Charlotte.

item.title: ‘They ain’t worried about the miners or people in West Virginia or coal miners anywhere’: Black lung sufferers despair over DC’s distance
item.description: The two reddest states in America — Wyoming and West Virginia — had the highest overall worker death rates in 2023, according to government figures.

item.title: 5 Reasons to Apply to Inc. Regionals Now
item.description: It’s your chance to be recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in your region of the U.S.

item.title: How This Cult Olive Oil Brand Just Expanded Into Wine
item.description: With a limited edition wine release for the holidays, Graza CEO Andrew Benin reflects on the company’s meteoric growth—and what’s next.

item.title: This Is the Hidden Villain Sabotaging U.S. Health Care Reform
item.description: We keep blaming the wrong things for what ails American health care. This is the real problem—and how to fix it.

item.title: Trump cozies up to Central Asian leaders in hunt for rare earths resources
item.description: Trump and the officials from Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan held bilateral meetings in the Oval Office.

item.title: How to Hire in the Age of the AI Workplace
item.description: The prevalence of AI at work is changing the skills employers are looking for. Is your training up to scratch?

item.title: Trump ‘failed to consider the harms’ on SNAP benefits by withholding food aid during shutdown, judge rules
item.description: Find the money to fully fund SNAP benefits for November, the judge told the White House, which promptly appealed.

item.title: How Mamdani could push a bold redesign of New York’s streets
item.description: When he takes office next year, Zohran Mamdani will be the first mayor of New York City in decades not to own a car. Mamdani—who bikes and rides publi...

item.title: Exclusive: Outdoor recreation on U.S. public lands generates $351 million a day in economic activity
item.description: The United States has about 640 million acres of public land, covering national parks to conservation areas and wild rivers to lake shores. These land...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani visits Puerto Rico for annual NYC political power broker summit
item.description: The conference is something of a post-Election Day retreat for the state’s political movers and shakers at a Hilton hotel in San Juan.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package is approved by Tesla shareholders
item.description: The world’s richest man was just handed a chance to become history’s first trillionaire. Elon Musk won a shareholder vote on Thursday that would give ...
